result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommy L. Herman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

records.addlTxt: with elements and criminal case settlement

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF330 and 15CF346 called together at 3:13pm [mo]
Defendant Tommy L. Herman in court with Attorney Matthew Prior.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; 
Pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1 of Case 15CF330 and Counts #1 and #3 of Case 15CF346

Factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: all remaining counts 

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1 of Case 15CF330 and Counts #1 and #3 of Case 15CF346, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with condition

--On Count #1 of Case 15CF346: to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/ work-release privileges, to commence on 8/1 /16.

all other conditions are as laid out in the Criminal Case Settlement and adopted by the Court.

[which are:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession/ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--no possession/ ingestion of controlled substances without a prescription
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to provide DNA sample
--no contact with Breanna Binns
--to pay statutory costs]


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
Felony Firearm/ Voting Prohibition Warnings given
recess: 4:00pm

Cases 15CF330 and 15CF346 called together at 8:39am [mo]
Defendant Tommy L. Herman in court with attorney Matthew Prior.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

As to Both Cases:
Mr.Herman waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Informations admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--Defense stands mute, the Court enters pleas of "not guilty" on each count of the respective Informations


The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
recess: 8:51am

NEXT:   As to Both Cases: Plea/Sentencing on 3/21/16 at 3:00pm

Cases 15CF330 and 15CF346 called together at 9:00am [mo]
Defendant Tommy L. Herman appears in court.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Matthew Prior appears via telephone.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Prior requests to appear by phone due to personal and family illness
--no objection from ADA Hall
--the Court allow Atty. Prior to appear by phone

Atty. Prior gives case update.
The Court schedules both cases for Preliminary hearing.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Clerk announces dates.
recess: 9:04 am

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 2/15/16 at 8:30am(15CF330) and 9:00am(15CF346)

Cases 15CF346, 15CM313 and 15CF330 called together at 2:33pm [mo]
Defendant Tommy L. Herman in court with Attorney Matthew Prior.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF346 & 15CF330(Initial Appearance occurs):
The Court confirms Mr. Herman's date of birth and address on Criminal Complaints
Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
As to Case 15CF330: The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
As to Case 15CF346:The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

As to Case 15CF346: Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
As to Case 15CF330: Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

DA Happ orally motion to dismiss case 15CM313
--No Objection from Atty. Prior
--The Court dismisses Case #15CM313; The Court orders that Mr Herman is released from any bond or bail that was set in this case.

As to Case 15CF346: 
The Court requires a $2500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 

--No Contact with Yolanda Schultz
--No Contact with Tamechia McCrimmon
--No Contact with Breanna Binns
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking

As to Case 15CF330:
The Court requires a separate $2500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 

--No Contact with Yolanda Schultz
--No Contact with Tamechia McCrimmon
--No Contact with Breanna Binns
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking

recess: 2:49pm 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 11/18/15 at 1:40pm  (2) Status Conference on 1/12/16 at 9:00am
